pullRequest.body:
The motivation is that it is additivisable (even though it currently isn't) and is used in group theory files.


---

|3368|2|porting notes|

Current commit [83a62a9217](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/83a62a921779a47d0ad0867d01ce177ac0104b7d)
Reference commit [0d65177e02](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/0d65177e0207b72af613780440f477cf27e61aba)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21028~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

To me, the main issue feels like the import of `GroupTheory.Perm` into `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Action.End`: it "goes against the grain" of importing `Algebra` in `GroupTheory` but not the other way around. If we change the direction or split this somehow, do things start to look better?

I am not so sure: `Perm α` is the group of automorphisms of `α`, and `Algebra.Group.Action.End` is supposed to be about the monoid of endomorphisms and group of automorphisms, so the import seems natural. If anything, I think `GroupTheory.Perm.Basic` could be moved under `Algebra`. Also note that it was previously imported in `Algebra.Group.Action.Basic`, which I agree was wrong (and definitely wronger than I have here).

pullRequest.title: chore: move `MulDistribMulAction` under `Algebra.Group`

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Algebra/Group/Action): group similar lemmas

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21028~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

To me, the main issue feels like the import of `GroupTheory.Perm` into `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Action.End`: it "goes against the grain" of importing `Algebra` in `GroupTheory` but not the other way around. If we change the direction or split this somehow, do things start to look better?

I am not so sure: `Perm α` is the group of automorphisms of `α`, and `Algebra.Group.Action.End` is supposed to be about the monoid of endomorphisms and group of automorphisms, so the import seems natural. If anything, I think `GroupTheory.Perm.Basic` could be moved under `Algebra`. Also note that it was previously imported in `Algebra.Group.Action.Basic`, which I agree was wrong (and definitely wronger than I have here).
